channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Blocked footpath, 24th December
item.description:
Continuous problem with limebike left blocking footpath in this position, most probably the same rider, needs to be tracked and stopped, area seems to be getting worse.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Athelney Street, Southend, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Deep pothole next to manhole being eroded by large buses, 24th December
item.description:
Large road pothole adjacent to manhole cover that is being runover constantly and is therefore getting worse rapidly. Causing huge road noise and vibration within properties due to the heavy buses going over it regularly.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 45A, Mayplace Road East, Barnehurst, Bexleyheath, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Rubbish dumped outside HMO again, 24th December
item.description:
More rubbish dumped out 61 Hearns Road a HMO. Rubbish is now blowing down the street. It is blocking the pavement. Rubbish needs to be removed. It has appeared there overnight. Residents of this Hmo need to be spoken to this is the 2nd incident of dumping in 2 weeks.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 55, Hearns Road, St Paul's Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stones & debris, 24th December
item.description:
The parked cars are covering many stones , pebbles and litter. This part of turn road desperately needs cleaning. I have nearly slipped into an oncoming double decker bus coming down the hill because of loose gravel/stones.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 5, Anerley Hill, Crystal Palace, Greater London

item.title: Overflowing bins in Merriam Ave Carpark, 24th December
item.description:
All the bins in the Merriam Avenue Carpark are overflowing and blowing into surrounding properties. It’s filthy! There are simply not enough collections generally for the number of properties these bins service.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Eastway, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet
